com.gea.gui

Class Drama

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gea.gui.Component
      • com.gea.gui.Drama

  • public class Drama
extends Component
    This is a class that can show things like monologues and dialogues on the screen. You load a monologue/dialogue by using the loadLines or the loadFile fucntion. You can go to the next line of the dialogue by calling nextLine(). If you want the line to display instantly change instantDisplay to true. Be aware that the instantDisplay variable does not automatically change back to false when you call the nextLine function. You can also add commands to instances of this class. After a command is added. All lines that start with the command name will be parsed as a command and the rest of the line will be split by whitespaces and put into the action as arguments. Be aware that argument with index of 0 is the name of the command and not the first argument.
    Author:
    Joakim

      • typeMoreIfNeeded

        public void typeMoreIfNeeded(org.newdawn.slick.Graphics gr)
        This will check if the typeTimer is done. If the typeTimer is done, then it will put the next character from the line into the visible line. If the character is at the beginning of a word it checks if the visible line + that word will be too wide for the specified width for the instance. If true, then it will begin a new line if available height is enough. If false, it will put the character from the line into the visible line, like in normal behavior. If instantDisplay is true, it will not wait for any timer to go out and will not stop processing characters before the line is fully processed(while loop).
        Parameters:
        gr - - graphic instance(slick2d library)

      • update

        public void update(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gc,

      • nextLine

        public void nextLine()
        Goes to the next line of the monologue/dialogue

      • addCommand

        public void addCommand(java.lang.String command,
                       Action a)
        Adds a command to Drama instance. After the command is added it will parse lines, where the first word is the command name, into commands and then split the line by whitespaces. This means that first index of arguments from the action instance will be the command name and not the first argument passed in the line.
        Parameters:
        command - - the wanted name of the command
        a - - the action to be performed when the command is used in a line
